OrderSummaryRoutingSchedule.name: OrderSummaryRoutingSchedule
OrderSummaryRoutingSchedule.description: Represents an attempt to route an order summary to one or more inventory locations for fulfillment. You can use it to schedule future attempts and to record completed attempts.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

Name.description: The name of the order summary routing schedule.

OrderSummaryId.description: (Master-Detail) The order summary associated with the routing schedule.

OwnerId.description: ID of the User who currently owns this order summary routing schedule. Default value is the User logged in to the API to perform the create.

Reason.description: Reason for the routing attempt. You can customize this list.

ScheduleStatus.description: Identifies whether this routing attempt has already run or is scheduled to run.

ScheduledDatetime.description: Identifies when this routing attempt was run or is scheduled to run. If the ScheduleStatus is ABANDONED or COMPLETED, then you can’t modify this value.

OrderSummaryRoutingSchedule.accessRules: This object is only available in Salesforce Order Management orgs or if the B2B Commerce license is enabled.
